metadata.description: Universal risk factors, adverse events, and protocols applicable across psychedelic substances

crossReferenceFormat.description: Use dot notation for cross-schema references

riskFactorCategories.name: Individual Risk Factors
riskFactorCategories.description: Personal characteristics and conditions affecting psychedelic response

riskFactorCategories.name: Legal Context Risk Factors
riskFactorCategories.description: Impact of legal status and regulation

physiological.name: Obstructive Respiratory Syndromes
physiological.description: Conditions affecting breathing and oxygen exchange

physiological.name: Epilepsy or Seizure History
physiological.description: Personal or family history of seizures

psychiatric.name: Personal or Family History of Psychotic Disorders
Bipolar Disorder
psychiatric.description: Personal or family history of bipolar disorder

applicableTo.emergingNuance: May be safer in controlled settings than previously thought

psychiatric.name: Personality Disorders
psychiatric.description: Cluster A, B, or C personality disorders

psychiatric.name: Pre-existing Anxiety or Depression
psychiatric.description: Active or history of anxiety or depressive disorders

applicableTo.nuance: Can be therapeutic target but also risk factor

anxietyWorsening.context: Among those with negative psychological responses

psychiatric.name: Suicidal Ideation or History
psychiatric.description: Active suicidal thoughts or past attempts

applicableTo.complexEvidence: Population studies show protective effects but individual cases show risks

psychiatric.name: Poor Coping Skills and Emotional Instability
Acute Stressful Life Circumstances
psychiatric.description: Ongoing major life stressors or changes

psychiatric.name: Unprocessed Trauma History
psychiatric.description: History of traumatic experiences, especially if unresolved

ptsdReexperiencing.context: In ceremonial ayahuasca with PTSD diagnosis

psychiatric.therapeuticPotential: May be beneficial with proper support

demographic.name: Adolescence and Young Adulthood
demographic.description: Younger age associated with increased vulnerability

demographic.name: Sex and Gender Differences

risks: Higher probability of physical adverse effects

recommendations: Additional monitoring for women using MDMA
Trauma-informed approaches for women with assault history

personality.name: High Neuroticism
personality.description: Tendency toward emotional instability, anxiety, worry

personality.name: Low Openness to Experience
personality.description: Preference for routine, resistance to new experiences

applicableTo.effect: May reduce positive outcomes rather than increase risks

personality.impact: Lower likelihood of mystical experiences and positive outcomes

personality.name: High Suggestibility
personality.description: Susceptibility to external influence and suggestion

personality.name: Dysfunctional Attitudes
personality.description: Rigid, maladaptive beliefs and thought patterns

personality.name: Difficulty with Surrender and Acceptance
personality.description: Resistance to letting go, need for control

experience.name: Lack of Psychedelic Experience
experience.description: First-time or limited experience with psychedelics

experience.name: Inadequate Preparation
experience.description: Insufficient understanding or readiness for the experience

experience.name: Prior Challenging Experiences
experience.description: Previous difficult or traumatic psychedelic experiences
experience.effect: Increased likelihood of similar challenges in future
experience.recommendation: Seek professional guidance before further use

dosageAndUse.name: High Dosage
dosageAndUse.description: Doses exceeding recommended or typical ranges
dosageAndUse.doseResponseRelationship: As dose increases, likelihood of negative effects increases

dosageAndUse.name: Frequent or Regular Use
dosageAndUse.description: Using psychedelics multiple times per month or more

dosageAndUse.name: Unknown Dose or Purity
dosageAndUse.description: Uncertainty about substance quantity or composition

dosageAndUse.name: Concurrent Polydrug Use
dosageAndUse.description: Use of multiple substances simultaneously or in close temporal proximity

prevalenceInDeaths.context: Most common theme in psychedelic-related deaths

dangerousCombinations.effect: Variable - may reduce or exacerbate difficulty

practitionerClientRiskFactors.name: Client Impaired Judgment and Vulnerability
practitionerClientRiskFactors.description: Heightened suggestibility and vulnerability during psychedelic states
specificRisks: Reduced ability to recognize harmful situations

practitionerClientRiskFactors.name: Weak Therapeutic Alliance
practitionerClientRiskFactors.description: Poor quality relationship between practitioner and client

practitionerClientRiskFactors.name: Inadequate Practitioner Training or Experience
practitionerClientRiskFactors.description: Lack of sufficient training in psychedelic-assisted therapy
specificRisks: Inability to navigate complex ethical dilemmas

practitionerClientRiskFactors.name: Therapist Lack of Self-Awareness
practitionerClientRiskFactors.description: Insufficient reflection on personal motives and biases

boundaryViolations.name: Sexual Misconduct
boundaryViolations.description: Sexual touching, contact, or exploitation during psychedelic therapy

prevalenceData.context: Of sexual misconduct perpetrators were underground sitters/guides
Participants knowing someone who experienced sexual violations

boundaryViolations.name: Financial Exploitation
boundaryViolations.description: Taking financial advantage of vulnerable clients

boundaryViolations.name: Emotional Manipulation or Abuse
boundaryViolations.description: Using power imbalance to manipulate or emotionally abuse clients

boundaryViolations.name: Epistemic Harm and Belief Imposition
boundaryViolations.description: Imposing beliefs or interpretations onto participants

interpersonalRiskFactors.name: Pre-existing Relationship Tensions
interpersonalRiskFactors.description: Using psychedelics with people with whom there are unresolved conflicts

prevalenceData.context: Of those with negative experiences took psychedelics with someone they had relationship issues with

recommendations: Avoid using with people you have active conflicts with
If working on relationships, do so with professional facilitation

interpersonalRiskFactors.name: Lack of Social Support
interpersonalRiskFactors.description: Absence of supportive relationships or safety measures
interpersonalRiskFactors.effect: Increases risk of challenging experiences and need for medical attention

interpersonalRiskFactors.name: Collective Suggestibility and Belief Shaping
interpersonalRiskFactors.bidirectional: Can lead to healthy or unhealthy outcomes

interpersonalRiskFactors.name: Emotional Contagion
interpersonalRiskFactors.description: Spread of emotional states within group

settingRiskFactors.name: Unsafe, Uncomfortable, or Unsupportive Settings
settingRiskFactors.description: Stressful, chaotic, or unsupportive physical/social environments

settingRiskFactors.name: Artificiality of Clinical Settings
settingRiskFactors.description: Sterile, impersonal nature of clinical environments

settingRiskFactors.name: Lack of Screening in Retreats
settingRiskFactors.description: Insufficient screening in retreat or religious contexts

settingRiskFactors.name: Cultic Dynamics in Groups
settingRiskFactors.description: Cult-like group dynamics and belief systems

settingRiskFactors.name: Unqualified Facilitators
settingRiskFactors.description: Lack of proper training or oversight

preparationIntegrationRiskFactors.name: Inadequate Screening
preparationIntegrationRiskFactors.description: Insufficient assessment of contraindications and vulnerabilities
shouldScreen: Personal history of psychosis, mania, bipolar

preparationIntegrationRiskFactors.name: Inadequate Education and Information
preparationIntegrationRiskFactors.description: Insufficient knowledge about effects and risks

preparationIntegrationRiskFactors.name: Insufficient Psychological Preparation
preparationIntegrationRiskFactors.description: Lack of preparation to address vulnerabilities

preparationIntegrationRiskFactors.name: Unclear Intentions and Goals
preparationIntegrationRiskFactors.description: Lack of clear purpose for the experience

preparationIntegrationRiskFactors.name: Lack of Integration Practices
preparationIntegrationRiskFactors.description: Absence of post-session processing and meaning-making

preparationIntegrationRiskFactors.name: Lack of Support and Guidance
preparationIntegrationRiskFactors.description: Absence of professional or peer support post-session

preparationIntegrationRiskFactors.name: Insufficient Time for Processing
preparationIntegrationRiskFactors.description: Rushing back to routine without reflection time

preparationIntegrationRiskFactors.name: Dismissing or Minimizing Challenging Experiences
preparationIntegrationRiskFactors.description: Attempting to ignore difficult aspects of experience

culturalSpiritualRiskFactors.name: Lack of Cultural Context and Understanding
culturalSpiritualRiskFactors.description: Absence of appropriate cultural framework for experience

culturalSpiritualRiskFactors.name: Lack of Culturally Competent Care
culturalSpiritualRiskFactors.description: Care that doesn't respect or respond to cultural backgrounds

culturalSpiritualRiskFactors.name: Spiritual Imposition
culturalSpiritualRiskFactors.description: Imposing spiritual or religious beliefs on clients

legalSocioeconomicRiskFactors.name: Prohibition-Related Lack of Quality Control
legalSocioeconomicRiskFactors.description: Absence of regulation leading to variable purity and adulterants

legalSocioeconomicRiskFactors.name: Reluctance to Seek Help Due to Legal Fears
legalSocioeconomicRiskFactors.description: Fear of legal repercussions prevents help-seeking

legalSocioeconomicRiskFactors.name: Research Barriers from Schedule I Classification
Disproportionate Legal Enforcement
legalSocioeconomicRiskFactors.description: Racialized drug policies lead to disproportionate arrests

legalSocioeconomicRiskFactors.name: Cost of Therapy and Socioeconomic Barriers
legalSocioeconomicRiskFactors.description: Financial barriers limiting access to safe use

specificBarriers.impact: Rural and underserved areas lack access
Inflexible jobs or hourly wages can't participate

consequences: Wealthy get therapeutic access; poor relegated to unregulated market
Higher unsafe use in lower SES

legalSocioeconomicRiskFactors.name: Economic Stress and Mental Health Burden
legalSocioeconomicRiskFactors.description: Poverty and economic stress increase vulnerabilities
mechanisms: Self-medication due to lack of affordable care

overdoseData.finding: Highest overdose death rates in counties with highest income inequality

legalSocioeconomicRiskFactors.name: Limited Healthcare Access
legalSocioeconomicRiskFactors.description: Inability to access medical and mental health services

legalSocioeconomicRiskFactors.name: Race and Ethnicity Moderation of Effects
legalSocioeconomicRiskFactors.description: Protective effects reduced for racial and ethnic minorities
legalSocioeconomicRiskFactors.finding: Protective effects against distress and suicidality significantly lower for minorities than White participants
legalSocioeconomicRiskFactors.mechanismHypothesis: Discrimination impacts naturalistic use, reducing protective associations

contaminationQualityRiskFactors.name: Adulteration with NBOMe Compounds
contaminationQualityRiskFactors.description: Presence of NBOMe compounds instead of or in addition to advertised substance

contaminationQualityRiskFactors.name: Adulteration with Fentanyl and Opioids
contaminationQualityRiskFactors.description: Presence of fentanyl or other opioids

specificExamples.variability: Significant between species, growing conditions, storage
Hot spots and cold spots within same batch
Increasing average content (2-3x typical dose common)

contaminationQualityRiskFactors.name: Storage and Degradation
contaminationQualityRiskFactors.description: Loss of potency over time due to improper storage

universalAdverseEvents.name: Acute Anxiety
universalAdverseEvents.description: Anxiety during or shortly after administration

prevalenceRange.context: Wide variation across studies and substances

temporalPattern.canPersist: May last hours beyond peak in some cases

associatedWithWorseLongTerm.context: Among those with negative psychological responses

universalAdverseEvents.name: Panic Reactions
universalAdverseEvents.description: Intense fear, overwhelming anxiety, sense of losing control

universalAdverseEvents.name: Dysphoria and Challenging Experiences
universalAdverseEvents.therapeuticPotential: May be part of therapeutic process if properly supported

universalAdverseEvents.name: Hallucinogen Persisting Perception Disorder (HPPD)
universalAdverseEvents.description: Persistent perceptual disturbances long after drug effects worn off
universalAdverseEvents.clinicalTrialsData: No cases reported in contemporary controlled trials

universalAdverseEvents.name: Prolonged Psychotic Reactions
universalAdverseEvents.description: Psychotic symptoms lasting days, weeks, or longer

universalAdverseEvents.name: Worsening of Pre-existing Mental Health Conditions
Persisting Negative Psychological Effects
universalAdverseEvents.description: Anxiety, depression, paranoia, emotional instability persisting post-experience

prevalenceData.context: Non-clinical users experienced negative outcomes with functional impairment

universalAdverseEvents.name: Suicidal Ideation
universalAdverseEvents.description: Thoughts of suicide following psychedelic experience

applicableTo.complexEvidence: Population studies protective, but individual cases reported

contextualFactors: Typically not seen in controlled settings
May be due to underlying issues rather than direct effect
Occurred in weeks following treatment in trials

universalAdverseEvents.name: Risk of Physical Harm
universalAdverseEvents.description: Behavior during experience putting self at physical risk

prevalenceData.context: Reported behavior putting self at risk

universalAdverseEvents.name: Headache
universalAdverseEvents.description: Head pain during or after experience

universalAdverseEvents.name: Increased Heart Rate and Blood Pressure
universalAdverseEvents.monitoring: Important in those with cardiovascular conditions

emergencyResponseProtocols.name: Non-Pharmacological Interventions

interventions.description: Maintain observation and regular verbal contact
Remind that experience is temporary, drug-related, and they are safe
Help participant focus on present moment

emergencyResponseProtocols.effectiveness: High - manages most cases of distress

emergencyResponseProtocols.name: Emergency Medical Services
whenToCall: Condition does not improve with interventions

emergencyResponseProtocols.name: Psychedelic Crisis Helplines
emergencyResponseProtocols.impact: Can prevent escalation and reduce emergency services burden

preparationPractices.name: Intention Setting
preparationPractices.description: Process of defining clear intentions and goals

preparationPractices.name: Life Review
preparationPractices.description: Comprehensive review of participant's life history

skills.description: Methods to stay in present moment

substanceToGeneralRisk.description: Substance-specific schemas reference general risk factors by ID

generalToSubstance.description: General risk factors indicate which substances they apply to
generalToSubstance.format: Use applicableTo object with substanceIds array

complexInteractions.description: Document interactions between multiple risk factors and substances
complexInteractions.location: complexInteractions array in general schema or substance schema
complexInteractions.format: List of factor objects with combined effect description
